ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend the first half of this class to a wide variety of students, but not the second second. Economics phd students, of course, have to take the class.

first quarter equips you with a lot of tools to solve continuous time problems and also is a good introduction to investment and labor models.second quarter, monetary economics, is a lot like the second half of 510 in the sense that we are solving a lot of models that are all very similar. however, the models seem better motivated in this case.
Yes. The topics are interesting and easy to understand.
Yes, I think I learned techniques and ways of thinking about problems that are useful to understand.
It is a required class, but I would recommend it.
If you are interested in macro, it's a good course to start with. Even if you are not, this course still covers a lot of interesting topics that a economist should be familiar with.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: seeing the material covered by Giuseppe really helped me decide that I wanted to study macro. I do feel that because we covered so little material in monetary economics that I would be at a disadvantage if I wanted to be a monetary economist.
I learned tools and models that are central to macroeconomics.
It greatly deepened my knowledge of macroeconomics. I feel much more comfortable in the general field now.
Yes. It expanded my knowledge and interest in macroeconomics in general. I'm considering it as one of my possible field seriously.
I learned several new techniques for addressing macroeconomic questions.
We coverd a lot of interesting topics and useful tools.
I learn completely new models, which could be used in my future research.
